column4: has anyone heard of this problem I am having on my laptop running hoary, after some X amount of time running on battery (this never happens when on AC) the computer freezes...so completly that I have to shut it down....usually this happens when I am using the touchpad
acpi standby locks my laptop up since I installed the fglrx driver
really.....I recently also installed fglrx
have you solved the problem by removing it or?
your touchpad may not be queried by acpi properly and you system goes into standby, thus locking it
no, I disabled standby
how would I go about fixing that...do you know?
at 1920x1200 resolutions the binary drivers make a big difference, it was a trade off
I see..
I'm hear that acpi standby/suspend won't work with the binary drivers
well I aint using the driver now its just installed
xorg isn't configured for it?
no I dont think so
'cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep fglrx' will tell you
if not configured then that command will return nothing
yeah ...nothing
does it happen when your machine is left idle too or just when using touchpad?
it only happens when I am on battery.....and It happens while I am working on it......all of a sudden it freezes completle...the hdd lights it lid constantly and I have to brutaly shut it down
I'd say that acpi would be an obvious culprit
do you have any other battery monitor tools installed?
nope....nothing extra
what's the make and model of your laptop?
Compaq X1000
